DropsRNA¶

Design¶

The key question for Drops Pipeline design.

  • Split the barcode;
  • Tagging reads from genome position;

Functions¶

Classes

reference(star_index_dir, cellranger_refs) About the references of cellranger for counting the 10X data.

Pipelines22

pipeline(config, genome, protocol, cells, …) Run the Data Processing Pipeline…

Barcode Processing

extract_barcode(protocol, seq) Extract cell barcode from reads 1 sequences, if protocol not defined, return blank.
extract_UMI(protocol, barcode, seq1[, …]) Extract UMI from reads 1 sequences.
count_barcode(path, output, protocol[, …]) Count the number of the barcodes (), write a count file.
valid_barcode([protocol, barcode_count, …]) Aggregate the mismatch barcode, get the total_reads;
check_whitelist(bc_white, protocol, barcode) Check whitelist.
split_by_barcode(name, protocol, bcstats, …) Split raw read2 file into 16 files according to the valid barcode in the bcstats files.
split_by_barcode_faster(name, protocol, …) Split the read2 files for each barcode prefix.

Alignments

star_align(bc_dir, workdir, sample, genome, …) Run Star Alignments in parallel.
tagging_reads(genome, bam, outpath) tagging_reads will read the bam file which sorted by header or barcode, report the UMIs and reads counts for each expressed genes of a barcode.

Stats

stats_table(counts, umis) Stats on the table of UMIs :: from baseq.drops import stats_table stats_table(“counts.txt”, “UMIs.txt”)

APIs¶

baseqdrops.extract_barcode(protocol, seq)[source]¶
Extract cell barcode from reads 1 sequences, if protocol not defined, return blank.
  • 10X: seq[0:16]
  • indrop: seq[0:i] + seq[i + 22 : i + 22 + 8] (i is length of barcode 1)
  • dropseq: seq[0:12]

Usages:

from baseqdrops import extract_barcode
extract_barcode("10X", "ATCGATCGATCGACTAAATTTTTTT")

#You can speficy the UMI and barcode length
extract_barcode("10X", "ATCGATCGATCGACTAAATTTTTTT", 14, 5)
Returns:barcode sequence, if no valid barcode, return “”
baseqdrops.extract_UMI(protocol, barcode, seq1, missing_base=False)[source]¶

Extract UMI from reads 1 sequences. If the reads length too short, return blank.

10X: 16-26
10X_14_10, 10X_14_5: 14:19/ 14:24
indrop: seq1[len(barcode) + 22:len(barcode) + 22 + 6]
dropseq: 11-19/12-20
Parameters:
  • barcode – Provide the barcode sequences;
  • seq1 – The sequence of read1;

Usage:

from baseqdrop import extract_UMI
extract_UMI("", "", "AA....TTT", False)
baseqdrops.count_barcode(path, output, protocol, min_reads=50, topreads=1000)[source]¶

Count the number of the barcodes (), write a count file. Usage:

from baseqdrops import count_barcode
count_barcodes("10X.1.fq.gz", "bc.counts.txt", "10X", min_reads=50, topreads=1000)
Parameters:
  • min_reads (int) – The barcode with reads lower than this will be discard (50).
  • topreads (str) – To process the top N millions of reads (1000).
Returns:

A csv file of barcode_count, by default (bc.counts.txt) cellbarcode/counts
baseqdrops.valid_barcode(protocol='', barcode_count='', max_cell=10000, min_reads=2000, output='bc.stats.txt')[source]¶

Aggregate the mismatch barcode, get the total_reads;

Note

  1. Read the barcode counts files;
  2. Correct the barcode with 1bp mismatch;
  3. Stats the mismatch barcode reads and sequences;
  4. Determine the last base of barcode is missed (mainly for drop-seq);
  5. Filter the barcode whitelist;
  6. Filter barcodes by read counts >= min_reads (2000);
  7. Filter barcodes by the max number of cells;
  8. Print the number of barcode and reads retained after each steps.

Examples:

from baseqdrops.barcode.stats import valid_barcode
valid_barcode("10X", "bc.counts.txt",
    max_cell=10000, min_reads=2000, output="bc.stats.txt")

This write a bc_stats.csv file (CSV) which contains:

barcode/counts/mismatch_reads/mismatch_bc/mutate_last_base
baseqdrops.check_whitelist(bc_white, protocol, barcode)[source]¶

Check whitelist.

Usage:

check_whitelist(bc_white, "10X", "ATTATATATT")
baseqdrops.split_by_barcode(name, protocol, bcstats, fq1, fq2, dir, topreads=10)[source]¶

Split raw read2 file into 16 files according to the valid barcode in the bcstats files.

  • Determine whether the last base mutates;
  • Filter by whitelist;
  • read barcode stats…
  • build barcode correction table…
  • build barcode_mutate_last list…

Usage:

from baseq.drops import split_by_barcode
split("10X_1", "10X", "bc.stats.txt", "10X_1.1.fq.gz", "10X_1.2.fq.gz", "./10X_1", topreads=10)
Results:
The splitted reads will be write to XXXX/split.[AA…..GG].fa
baseqdrops.star_align(bc_dir, workdir, sample, genome, parallel)[source]¶

Run Star Alignments in parallel. Uasge:

from baseqdrops.run_star import star_align
star_align(bc_dir, workdir, sample, genome, parallel=4)

Results:

Aligned.AA.bam
baseqdrops.tagging_reads(genome, bam, outpath)[source]¶

tagging_reads will read the bam file which sorted by header or barcode, report the UMIs and reads counts for each expressed genes of a barcode.

Parameters:
  • genome – The name of genome (hg38);
  • bam – The bam file (should sorted by header);
  • outpath – The path of genes expression files;

Todo

  • Check the existence of reference files;
Returns:A file for tagged reads;
BARCODE#{}
Return type:path
baseqdrops.stats_table(counts, umis)[source]¶

Stats on the table of UMIs

from baseq.drops import stats_table
stats_table("counts.txt", "UMIs.txt")
baseqdrops.pipeline(config, genome, protocol, cells, minreads, name, fq1, fq2, dir, top_million_reads, step, parallel)[source]¶

Run the Data Processing Pipeline…

  1. Stats and count the barcode from pair-end 1 sequences;
  2. Read the barcode counts files;
  3. Correct the barcode with 1bp mismatch;
  4. Stats the mismatch barcode reads and sequences;
  5. Determine wheather mutate on the last base (show A/T/C/G with similar ratio at the last base);
  6. Filter by whitelist;
  7. Filter by read counts (>=min_reads);
  8. Print the number of barcode and reads retained after each steps.

Usage:

from baseqdrops import pipeline
pipeline("", "hg38", "10X", 1000, minreads, name, fq1, fq2, dir, top_million_reads, step, parallel)

#specify the length of UMI and barcodes
pipeline("", "hg38", "10X", 1000, minreads, name, fq1, fq2, dir, top_million_reads, step, parallel)

#Run in command line
baseqdrops

Protocols:

  1. For 10X: 16bp Barcode and 10 bp UMI => 10X (most commonly used)
  2. For 10X: 14bp Barcode and 5/10 bp UMIs => 10X_14_10 / 10X_14_5 (For some old version data)
  3. For DropSeq ==> dropseq
  4. For inDrop ==> indrop
Parameters:
  • config – The path of configuration file;
  • genome – Genome version (hg38, mm10, hg38_mm10);
  • cells – Max number of cells;
  • minreads – Minimum number of reads for a cell barcode (10000);
  • name – Samplename;
  • fq2 (fq1,) – Path to fastq reads;
  • dir – The folder for processing, a folder with samplename will be created;
  • top_million_reads – Number of reads used for processing in Million;
  • step – Steps to run;
  • parallel – How many thread to use;
Steps:
count stats split star tagging table
class baseqdrops.reference(star_index_dir, cellranger_refs)[source]¶

About the references of cellranger for counting the 10X data.

from baseq.drops import reference
refs = reference("XXXX")

Todo

目前函数抽离的工作还没有work。 类还无法使用。

align_to_transcriptome(chrID, start, alength)[source]¶

Get the overlap transcription names.

refs.get_overlap_transc("chr1", start, end)
> ['ENST....', 'ENST...']
overlap_exons(chr, start, end)[source]¶

Get the overlap exons.

read_index(cellranger_refs, star_index_dir)[source]¶

Read the cellranger and star index files. It has the following properities:

chrom_names: []
chrom_starts: [tx_ids', 'tx_starts', 'tx_ends', 'tx_max_ends', 'tx_strands', 'tx_num_exons', 'tx_break_idxs']
tx_info: []
ex_info: ['ex_starts', 'ex_ends', 'ex_cum_lengths']
ex_tx: ['gene', 'tx', 'genename']
